csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Triangular Moving Average (TMA)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Additional smoothing of a Simple Moving Average.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>TMA = SMA of SMA.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Weights are triangular (heaviest in the middle).</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Very smooth, but has more lag than SMA/EMA.</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class TriangularMovingAverage
18 {
19 public int Period { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
21​
22 public TriangularMovingAverage(int period)
23 {
24 if (period <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException();
25 Period = period;
26 }
27​
28 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
29 {
30 Values.Clear();
31 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
32 if (candleList.Count < Period) return;
33​
34 // 1. First SMA
35 var sma1 = new List<decimal?>();
36 decimal sum = 0;
37 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
38 {
39 sum += candleList[i].Close;
40 if (i >= Period) sum -= candleList[i - Period].Close;
41​
42 if (i >= Period - 1) sma1.Add(sum / Period);
43 else sma1.Add(null);
44 }
45​
46 // 2. Second SMA (of the First SMA)
47 decimal sum2 = 0;
48 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
49 {
50 if (sma1[i].HasValue)
51 {
52 sum2 += sma1[i]!.Value;
53 if (i >= 2 * Period - 1)
54 sum2 -= sma1[i - Period]!.Value;
55 }
56​
57 if (i >= 2 * Period - 2)
58 Values.Add(sum2 / Period);
59 else
60 Values.Add(null);
61 }
62 }
63​
64 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period)
65 {
66 var tma = new TriangularMovingAverage(period);
67 tma.Calculate(candles);
68 return tma.Values;
69 }
70 }
71}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// TRIANGULAR MOVING AVERAGE (TMA) - Extreme Tutorial Mode
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// [What] Triangular Moving Average (TMA) is a double-smoothed moving average
6// calculated as the SMA of an SMA. This creates a "triangular" weight
7// distribution that peaks in the center of the lookback period.
8//
9// [Why] SMA weights all values equally, which can be noisy. TMA places more
10// emphasis on the center of the period:
11// - Very smooth output (double smoothing)
12// - More lag than SMA (price of smoothness)
13// - Center-weighted: Recent and old data de-emphasized
14//
15// [Visual] Weight Distribution Comparison:
16//
17// SMA (Period 5): Equal weights
18// │ ▓ ▓ ▓ ▓ ▓ │ All bars contribute equally
19//
20// TMA (Period 5): Triangular weights
21// │ ░ ▓ █ ▓ ░ │ Center bars contribute most
22//
23// Weight visualization:
24// 1 2 3 4 5 <- time
25// ▁ ▃ █ ▃ ▁ <- TMA weight profile (triangular)
26//
27// [How] Algorithm:
28//
29// ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
30// │ TMA = SMA( SMA(Close, Period), Period ) │
31// │ │
32// │ Step 1: Calculate first SMA over Period bars │
33// │ Step 2: Calculate second SMA on the first SMA results │
34// └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
35//
36// [Formula]
37// SMA1 = (Close[0] + Close[1] + ... + Close[N-1]) / N
38// TMA = (SMA1[0] + SMA1[1] + ... + SMA1[N-1]) / N
39//
40// =============================================================================
41​
42using System;
43using System.Collections.Generic;
44using System.Linq;
45​
46namespace TechnicalIndicators
47{
48 // =========================================================================
49 // [What] CandleData: Immutable record for OHLCV price bar data
50 // =========================================================================
51 public readonly record struct CandleData(
52 DateTime Timestamp,
53 decimal Open,
54 decimal High,
55 decimal Low,
56 decimal Close,
57 long Volume
58 );
59​
60 // =========================================================================
61 // [What] TriangularMovingAverage Class: Double-smoothed SMA
62 // =========================================================================
63 public class TriangularMovingAverage
64 {
65 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
66 // [What] Period: SMA period (applied twice)
67 // [Note] Effective lookback is about 2×Period due to double smoothing
68 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
69 public int Period { get; }
70​
71 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
72 // [What] Values: Stores the calculated TMA for each bar
73 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
74 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
75​
76 // =====================================================================
77 // [What] Constructor: Initialize with period
78 // =====================================================================
79 public TriangularMovingAverage(int period)
80 {
81 if (period <= 0)
82 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
83 Period = period;
84 }
85​
86 // =====================================================================
87 // [What] Calculate: Main computation method
88 // =====================================================================
89 //
90 // [IPO Block]
91 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
92 // │ INPUT: candles - Collection of OHLCV price bars │
93 // │ PROCESS: Calculate SMA, then SMA of SMA (double smoothing) │
94 // │ OUTPUT: Values list with TMA for each bar │
95 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
96 //
97 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
98 {
99 Values.Clear();
100 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
101​
102 if (candleList.Count < Period) return;
103​
104 // =================================================================
105 // PHASE 1: Calculate First SMA
106 // =================================================================
107 //
108 // [What] Standard SMA with O(1) sliding window
109 //
110 // [Visual] SMA1 Calculation (Period = 3):
111 // Index: 0 1 2 3 4
112 // Close: 100 102 101 105 103
113 // SMA1: null null 101 103 103
114 //
115 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
116 var sma1 = new List<decimal?>();
117 decimal sum = 0;
118 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
119 {
120 sum += candleList[i].Close;
121 if (i >= Period) sum -= candleList[i - Period].Close;
122​
123 if (i >= Period - 1) sma1.Add(sum / Period);
124 else sma1.Add(null);
125 }
126​
127 // =================================================================
128 // PHASE 2: Calculate Second SMA (SMA of SMA1)
129 // =================================================================
130 //
131 // [What] Apply SMA again to the SMA1 values
132 //
133 // [Visual] TMA Double Smoothing (Period = 3):
134 // SMA1: null null 101 103 103
135 // TMA: null null null null 102.33
136 //
137 // [Note] TMA warm-up period is approximately 2×Period - 1
138 //
139 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
140 decimal sum2 = 0;
141 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
142 {
143 // Add valid SMA1 values to second sum
144 if (sma1[i].HasValue)
145 {
146 sum2 += sma1[i]!.Value;
147​
148 // Remove old value when window exceeds Period
149 if (i >= 2 * Period - 1)
150 {
151 sum2 -= sma1[i - Period]!.Value;
152 }
153 }
154​
155 // Output TMA when second window is complete
156 if (i >= 2 * Period - 2)
157 {
158 Values.Add(sum2 / Period);
159 }
160 else
161 {
162 Values.Add(null);
163 }
164 }
165 }
166​
167 // =====================================================================
168 // [What] Calculate: Static convenience method
169 // =====================================================================
170 //
171 // [IPO Block]
172 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
173 // │ INPUT: candles - Price bars, period - Smoothing period │
174 // │ PROCESS: Create instance, calculate, return results │
175 // │ OUTPUT: List of TMA values for each bar │
176 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
177 //
178 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period)
179 {
180 var tma = new TriangularMovingAverage(period);
181 tma.Calculate(candles);
182 return tma.Values;
183 }
184 }
185}
python_simple:
1class TriangularMovingAverage:
2 """
3 TMA
4 """
5 def __init__(self, period=20):
6 self.period = period
7 self.values = []
8​
9 def calculate(self, candles):
10 self.values.clear()
11 if len(candles) < self.period: return
12​
13 # 1. SMA 1
14 sma1 = []
15 s = 0.0
16 for i in range(len(candles)):
17 s += float(candles[i]['close'])
18 if i >= self.period:
19 s -= float(candles[i-self.period]['close'])
20
21 if i >= self.period - 1:
22 sma1.append(s / self.period)
23 else:
24 sma1.append(None)
25
26 # 2. SMA 2 (of SMA 1)
27 s2 = 0.0
28 for i in range(len(candles)):
29 if sma1[i] is not None:
30 s2 += sma1[i]
31 if i >= 2 * self.period - 1:
32 s2 -= sma1[i-self.period]
33
34 if i >= 2 * self.period - 2:
35 self.values.append(s2 / self.period)
36 else:
37 self.values.append(None)
38​
39def calculate(candles, period=20):
40 obj = TriangularMovingAverage(period)
41 obj.calculate(candles)
42 return obj.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Triangular Moving Average)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Triangular Moving Average (TRIMA).
7#
8# [Core Concepts]
9# 1. Weighting Profile
10# - SMA gives equal weight to all prices in the window.
11# - EMA gives exponential weight to recent prices.
12# - TRIMA gives maximum weight to the middle of the window, tapering
13# off to the sides (Triangle shape).
14#
15# 2. Calculation Trick
16# - TRIMA is mathematically equivalent to applying an SMA... TO an SMA.
17# - Formula: SMA( SMA(Price, N), N ).
18# - This double-smoothing creates the triangular weight distribution naturally.
19#
20# [Formula]
21# SMA1 = SMA(Price, Period)
22# TRIMA = SMA(SMA1, Period)
23#
24# =============================================================================
25​
26# -------------------------------------------------------------
27# Type-Level Explanation: TriangularMovingAverage (class)
28#
29# [Why] Extreme smoothing for volatile markets.
30# [What] Double-Averaged Price.
31# [How] Calculates the Simple Moving Average of the Simple Moving Average (SMA of SMA).
32# -------------------------------------------------------------
33class TriangularMovingAverage:
34
35 # -------------------------------------------------------------
36 # Constructor: __init__
37 # [Why] Period determines the width of the triangle base.
38 # -------------------------------------------------------------
39 def __init__(self, period):
40 if period <= 0:
41 raise ValueError("period must be > 0")
42 self.period = period
43 self.values = []
44​
45 # =============================================================================
46 # IPO: calculate
47 # =============================================================================
48 #
49 # [Input]
50 # - candles: List[dict]
51 #
52 # [Process]
53 # 1. Calculate SMA1 of Close prices.
54 # 2. Calculate SMA2 of SMA1 values.
55 # 3. Store result.
56 #
57 # [Output]
58 # - None (Populates values).
59 # =============================================================================
60 def calculate(self, candles):
61
62 # -------------------------------------------------------------
63 # Logic Step 1: Reset
64 # -------------------------------------------------------------
65 self.values.clear()
66 if len(candles) == 0:
67 return
68
69 # -------------------------------------------------------------
70 # Logic Step 2: First SMA Pass
71 # [Why] Create the base moving average.
72 # [How] Optimized Running Sum (O(N)).
73 # -------------------------------------------------------------
74 sma1_values = []
75 running_sum1 = 0.0
76
77 for i in range(len(candles)):
78 # Add New
79 running_sum1 += candles[i]['close']
80
81 # Remove Old
82 if i >= self.period:
83 running_sum1 -= candles[i - self.period]['close']
84
85 # Store SMA1
86 if i < self.period - 1:
87 sma1_values.append(None)
88 else:
89 sma1_values.append(running_sum1 / self.period)
90​
91 # -------------------------------------------------------------
92 # Logic Step 3: Second SMA Pass (TRIMA)
93 # [Why] Smooth the SMA to create the Triangle profile (Max weight at center).
94 # [How] Running Sum on 'sma1_values'.
95 # -------------------------------------------------------------
96 running_sum2 = 0.0
97 valid_count = 0
98
99 for i in range(len(sma1_values)):
100 val = sma1_values[i]
101
102 # Handle the startup gap (where SMA1 is None)
103 if val is None:
104 self.values.append(None)
105 continue
106
107 # Add New (SMA1 value)
108 running_sum2 += val
109 valid_count += 1
110
111 # Remove Old (SMA1 value leaving the second window)
112 # We need to look back 'period' indices in the valid stream.
113 # But since 'val' only appears after 'period-1' gap, we can
114 # map this to index logic:
115 # removing_index = i - period
116 if i >= (self.period - 1) + self.period:
117 # Need to remove the element that entered 'period' steps ago
118 # But sma1_values has Nones at start.
119 # removing_idx = i - self.period
120 # Ensure it's not None (it shouldn't be if logic is correct)
121 rem_val = sma1_values[i - self.period]
122 if rem_val is not None:
123 running_sum2 -= rem_val
124
125 # Check if second window is full
126 # Total lag = (Period-1) from SMA1 + (Period-1) from SMA2
127 # Total = 2*Period - 2
128 if valid_count < self.period:
129 self.values.append(None)
130 else:
131 trima = running_sum2 / self.period
132 self.values.append(trima)
133​
134​
135# =============================================================================
136# Static Wrapper Function
137# =============================================================================
138# [Usage] trima_values = calculate(candles, 20)
139# =============================================================================
140def calculate(candles, period):
141 tma = TriangularMovingAverage(period)
142 tma.calculate(candles)
143 return tma.values
